Description:
Facilitators: Marco Bertolino / Raphael Noirfalise

 

 

 

Welcome to R & SPACE Open-Office hours

 

This forum gives you the opportunity as (to be) R programmers and SPACE platform users

 

*	to bring up any related R/SPACE question
*	to share ideas
*	to show your solutions and/or discoveries that make SPACE/R live easier
*	…

 

At the same time, we look forward in helping you with your smooth transition to R and having a pleasant journey in SPACE!

Welcome to R & SPACE Open-Office hours

 

This forum gives you the opportunity as (to be) R programmers and SPACE platform users

 

*	to bring up any related R/SPACE question
*	to share ideas
*	to show your solutions and/or discoveries that make SPACE/R live easier
*	…

 

At the same time, we look forward in helping you with your smooth transition to R and having a pleasant journey in SPACE!

Description:
Please note that this invite is only relevant for Statisticians working in Clinical Development

 

 



 

 

Meeting recurrence every 2 weeks

 

 

IDAR C&SP

 

R-walk session EU/US

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Please join us for an R-walk session. 

 

If you have suggestions for topics or want to share your experiences, please use this form <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/Future-topics-for-the-R-walks.aspx> . You can also find more information about anything R related on the R-portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/> . The agenda with upcoming topics, and all the past material of the R-walks can be found on the R-walk page <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx> . 

 

The same session is organized in US/EU and APAC/EU time zone in the same week. You are free to choose one of both sessions. 

 

If you have any questions please contact Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com> , Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

 

Best regards,

The Community of Practice team

R-walk session EU/US

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

Please join us for an R-walk session. 

 

If you have suggestions for topics or want to share your experiences, please use this form <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/Future-topics-for-the-R-walks.aspx> . You can also find more information about anything R related on the R-portal <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/> . The agenda with upcoming topics, and all the past material of the R-walks can be found on the R-walk page <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/teams/R-Portal/SitePages/R-Walk-Material-Links-(continuous-updates).aspx> . 

 

The same session is organized in US/EU and APAC/EU time zone in the same week. You are free to choose one of both sessions. 

 

If you have any questions please contact Yingshan You <mailto:Yyou@its.jnj.com> , Yanlin Wang <mailto:YWang43@its.jnj.com>  or Annemie Van Dijck <mailto:avandijc@its.jnj.com> .

 

 

 

Best regards,

Subject: RPA Bot Walk & Talk / Open Office Hours
Optional Attendees: Ramabadran, Sendil [JRDUS];Henrick, Tracy [JRDUS];Li, Qianqian [JRDCN];Wang, Holly [JRDUS]
Description:
Meeting recurrence every 3 weeks

 

 

IDAR C&SP

 

RPA Bot-Walk & Talk / Open Office Hours

 

 

Dear Colleagues,

 

As we transition from innovation to full adoption, we’d like to invite you to these Bot sessions. In these session, you will have opportunity to get focused trainings, hear from your coworkers about Bot experiences, get your questions answered and also provide feedback to improve Bots. Interactive discussion is encouraged.

 

Even though you will have the opportunity to ask questions during the sessions, please also log your questions through our BOT Q&A in Red Desk 2.0 <https://jnj.sharepoint.com/sites/PHM-GCSP-RND/DDA/RedDesk/Pages/default.aspx> .


We look forward to your participation. 

 

If you have any questions, please contact DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ <mailto:DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ%20%3cDL-GD-IDAR-CSP-RPA-JNJ@its.jnj.com%3e> .

 

 

Best regards,

The C&SP RPA BOT Initiative Team

Description:
IDAR C&SP

Janssen SAS User's Group (JSUG)

 

Dear IDAR Colleagues,

 

 

Please join us as we revive the Janssen SAS Users’ Group (JSUG) mtgs to learn more about how Clinical & Statistical Programming groups are using SAS.

 

JSUG will be a place for you to get together virtually to discuss data usage, exchange ideas and improve organizational knowledge, methods, and practices. 

It will be a place where you can sharpen your skills & learn more about SAS technology.

 

TOPIC of April 4th 9.00 am EST meeting: SAS and Open Source
            on April 5th 9.00 am CET meeting: recording will be planned for Asia colleagues

SAS Meeting lead: Paula Kocor

J&J Meeting leads: L&D reps Margie Merlino/Ann Cuijpers

 

Regards,

 

 

C&SP Learning & Development Team

DL-GD-IDAR-C&SP-SSP-LnD= DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-SSP-LnD@its.jnj.com <mailto:DL-GD-IDAR-CSP-SSP-LnD@its.jnj.com>

Subject: End-to-end data science workflows with Posit Team
Description:
On the last Wednesday of every month, we host a Posit Team demo and Q&A session that is open to all. You can use this to add the event to your own calendar. 

On this month’s Posit Team Demo

Publishing a Dash application to Posit Connect. Led by: Ryan Johnson, Data Science Advisor. 

Dash applications make it easy to transform your analysis into an interactive dashboard using Python so users can ask and answer questions in real time without touching any code. 

Who are these monthly demos for? Everyone is welcome to join us - regardless of industry, background, or experience! We will discuss topics that will speak... 

--- 
Event details: 
https://www.addevent.com/event/Eg16505674

Subject: [In-Person] Let's Have Fun After Meeting
Optional Attendees: Li, Shechang [JRDCN];Liu, Xuelin [JRDCN];Chen, Yufan [JRDCN];Cheng, Qianqian [JRDCN];Liu, Xiaochang [JRDCN];Sun, Yuping [JRDCN];Djali, Sina [JRDUS]
Meeting Resources: CR-GC-CNShanghai, Bldg CHJ-A, Rm 4F-7 Global Connect (18)
Description:
Hi All,

 

We’ll utilize this timeslot to boost face-to-face connections with colleagues and LT. Do expect tons of fun games and activities, and you may have chance to win our surprise awards! 

 

Kindly note that this is an in-person-only ~15min event, and is not mandatory. But we would like to encourage employees to join the monthly meeting in office and take participate in this adjunctive activity, which is definitely a great opportunity to return to post-covid office, re-engage in our community, and re-connect with colleagues beyond projects. If you have any ideas or suggestions on how to advocate our in-person connection and collaboration, feel free to reach out to X-TA coordinators and Enliven team.

 

We hope everyone to relax, rejoice and have fun!

 

Best,

X-TA & Enliven team
Location: CR-GC-CNShanghai, Bldg CHJ-A, Rm 4F-7 Global Connect (18)

Subject: A.R.I.S.E. Indigenous/EU Book Club Kick-Off Meeting (2 of 2)
Description:
IDAR A.R.I.S.E. invites you to participate in the A.R.I.S.E. Indigenous/EU 2023 Book Club!  The book is entitled Liberating Sápmi: Indigenous Resistance in Europe’s Far North and is written by Gabriel Kuhn. 

 

There are 2 kickoff meetings to introduce everyone to the book’s topic, the Sámi.  Please attend the one which is convenient for your region. The book may be read over the Summer and book club discussion meetings will be held in the Fall.

 

08 May-2023 - 13:00 - 14:00 IST/15:30 - 16:30 CST/ 16:30 - 17:30 JST (ASIA/EU)

 

09 May-2023 – 9:00 – 10:00am EDT /  15:00 – 16:00 CET (US/EU)

 

The kickoff will provide a snapshot of the Sámi through a montage of videos combined with a concise set of slides that will bring everyone up-to-speed on the Sámi and the author Gabriel Kuhn. Click the link for an excerpt from the book’s overview found at PM Press <https://pmpress.org/index.php?l=product_detail&p=1051> 

 

 <http://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/>

Subject: Joint Celebration for SPRAVATO® China Approval
Description:
Dear Colleagues,

 

We are excited to invite you to a joint celebration for the recent approval of SPRAVATO® (esketamine hydrochloride nasal spray) in China for treating depressive symptoms in adults with major depressive disorder with acute suicidal ideation or behavior (MDSI). Thanks to our collective efforts, we have achieved the first product approval in Janssen Research & Development's 2023 Goals and Objectives. 

 

This is a fantastic opportunity to reflect and hear memorable stories of development behind the approval process, as well as connecting with each one of you. We would like to express our sincere gratitude to all those who contributed to this achievement and invite you to join us in celebrating the collaboration and hard work of our teams.

 

If you have time, please feel free to join us.

 

 

Best regards,

 

 

Zili Li

Head of Asia Pacific R&D

Janssen Research & Development

 

 

 

 

Bill Martin

Global Therapeutic Area Head, Neuroscience

Janssen Research & Development

Description:
Pre-Read on adaptability attached

 


IDAR L&D is excited to launch the IDAR Learning Together sessions.

Objectives: Own your soft skills development 

 

Take this unique opportunity to learn at your own pace and reflect on your learnings as an IDAR team to consolidate them and exchange your experience (30 min self-learning + 90 min together zoom session).  During the zoom session we will dive deep into the subject matter, engage in collaborative breakout activities and share best practices.

 

Curious to discover more? Embark on the journey with us for our first session: Embracing Change in the Workplace 

 

Take the first step and do the self-learning part before the end of May (it will only take less than 30 minutes in total. Additional tip: if the presenter speaks too slowly for you, accelerate the speed of play in YouTube parameters!)

Thanks and regards，

Subject: Seminar - Bioanalytical Strategies: Cell and Gene Therapies
Optional Attendees: Yang, Tong-Yuan [JRDUS];Feng, Guannan [JANCNBJ];DL-JRDCN China R&D SLT
Description:
Sorry that due to the conflict with fire drill, the timeslot has been updated. Thank you. 

Join the meeting <https://jnjmeetings.zoom.us/j/93698424309?pwd=T0RnMm5XMDA4UWpuU0Y5SWFGci94dz09> 



You're cordially invited to the Seminar by Dr. Tong-yuan Yang, Senior Scientific Director at Preclinical Sciences and Translational Safety, Janssen Research and Development, LLC. 


Bioanalytical Strategies: Cell and Gene Therapies



Modern drug modalities like cellular therapy and gene therapy offer new ways to treat human diseases once considered “untreatable.” During the clinical development, systematic and extensive PK & immunogenicity assessment are essential for clinical safety and efficacy evaluation. The challenges associated with bioanalytical evaluation are attributed to the unique delivery mechanisms and the intricate nature of immune responses to those multicomponent therapy modalities. Unlike conventional small and large molecules, no bioanalysis guidance for method validation of cellular and gene therapy has been developed yet. With this opportunity, Dr. Tong-Yuan Yang from PSTS Spring House will share his experiences on method development and validation of PK & immunogenicity to align with regulatory expectations for bioanalytical technologies utilized in cell and gene therapy.    




Dr. Yang’s Bio is attached. 






Yiwen Wang invited you to a meeting.

Description:
MasterClass: Storytelling to Present Data and Information (Option 1 of 3)
 
Thank you for registering for this MasterClass in Storytelling to present Data & Information. You can join through the link below.
